info.title: EasyVista Swagger Service Manager Rest API

license.name: CONDITIONS DE LICENCE ET SERVICES - LOGICIELS EASYVISTA

get.description:
Returns List of actions. This resource helps you to get asset list.
If no options are provided, an excerpt of the records is displayed. Example: http://your_server/api/v1/account/actions?max_rows=3 _Notes:_
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._

parameters.name: max_rows
parameters.description:
Maximum number of rows to be returned.

Example: __/assets?max_rows=5__

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort string.

Syntax: field1[+asc|+desc],field2[+asc|+desc]

Example: __/assets?sort=employee.last_name+desc__

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Selected fields to be returned

Example: __/assets?fields=asset_tag,serial_number,location.location_path,employee.last_name__

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search/Filter on fields. Example: __/assets?search=employee.e_mail:btalma@itassetservices.com__ Date filtering is also possible:
__/assets?search=employee.begin_of_contract:last_week__ More information : #docTextSection:tcvZ3t7EuhgHRuaRd

get.description:
Returns an action. This resource helps you to get asset list.
If no options are provided, an excerpt of the records is displayed. Example: http://your_server/api/v1/account/actions/{id} _Notes:_
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._

parameters.name: fields

Example: __/assets?fields=asset_tag,serial_number,location.location_path,employee.last_name__

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Action ID

parameters.description: Action ID

parameters.description: Action ID

get.description: Get record of all asset characteristics
Get an asset characteristics

Returns List of assets. This resource helps you to get asset list.
If no options are provided, an excerpt of the records is displayed. Example: http://your_server/api/v1/account/assets?max_rows=3&fields=asset_tag,serial_number,location.location_path,employee.last_name&sort=employee.last_name desc _Notes:_
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._

parameters.name: max_rows
parameters.description:
Maximum number of rows to be returned.

Example: __/assets?max_rows=5__

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort string.

Syntax: field1[+asc|+desc],field2[+asc|+desc]

Example: __/assets?sort=employee.last_name+desc__

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Selected fields to be returned

Example: __/assets?fields=asset_tag,serial_number,location.location_path,employee.last_name__

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search/Filter on fields. Example: __/assets?search=employee.e_mail:btalma@itassetservices.com__ Date filtering is also possible:

post.description:
This resource allows to create a new Asset.
Upon success, an HTTP 201 is returned. An HREF to the new resource is provided, and the HTTP Header contains a location information to redirect the client to the newly created resource.
_Catalog_id is mandatory_ _Note: this method only supports one asset creation per call (V1.0)_

assets.comment_asset: ip_input.c in BSD-derived TCP/IP implementations allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash or hang) via crafted packets.
ip_input.c in BSD-derived TCP/IP implementations allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash or hang) via crafted packets.

get.description:
Returns the specified Asset This resource helps you to get information about an Asset in EVSM. _Notes:_
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._ Example: **assets/18556**

put.description:
Update an Asset.
Upon success an HTTP 201 OK is returned. The URI to the updated resources is provided, and the HTTP Header constains a location information to redirect the client to the newly created resource.

If the record is not found, a 404 error is returned.

patch.description:
Update an Asset.
Upon success an HTTP 201 OK is returned. The URI to the updated resources is provided, and the HTTP Header constains a location information to redirect the client to the newly created resource.

If the record is not found, a 404 error is returned.

get.description:
Returns the specified Asset comment This resource helps you to get information about an Asset in EVSM. _Notes:_
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._ Example: **assets/18556**
Returns all assets linked
Returns the specified asset link.

put.description:
Updates the asset link.
Only Contract_row and Monthly_payment can be updated.

post.description:
Creates an asset link.
Only Contract_row and Monthly_payment can be added along with the two asset_ids.

patch.description:
Updates the asset link.
Only Contract_row and Monthly_payment can be updated.

get.description:
Returns List of catalog assets. This resource helps you to get catalog asset list.
If no options are provided, an excerpt of the records is displayed. Example: http://server-name/api/v1/account/catalog-assets?search=manufacturer.manufacturer~"*Pack*" _Notes:_
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._

parameters.name: max_rows
parameters.description:
Maximum number of rows to be returned.

Example: __/assets?max_rows=5__

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort string.

Syntax: field1[+asc|+desc],field2[+asc|+desc]

Example: __/assets?sort=employee.last_name+desc__

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Selected fields to be returned

Example: __/assets?fields=asset_tag,serial_number,location.location_path,employee.last_name__

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search/Filter on fields. Example: __/assets?search=employee.e_mail:btalma@itassetservices.com__ Date filtering is also possible:
__/assets?search=employee.begin_of_contract:last_week__ More information : #docTextSection:tcvZ3t7EuhgHRuaRd

post.description:
Creates a new catalog asset.

Utilize this endpoint to add a new catalog asset to the database.

get.description:
Returns the specified Configuration Item This resource helps you to get information about a Configuration Item in EVSM. _Notes:_
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._ Example: **configuration-items/18556**

post.description: Declare the unavaibility of a CI

get.description:
Returns the specified Configuration Item Comment This resource helps you to get information about a Configuration Item in EVSM. _Notes:_
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._ Example: **configuration-items/18556**

Returns all the relations between configuration items that are impacted by the given configuration item.
Optionnal linked_ci parameter allows to find if a specific item is impacted by the configuration item.

Example: http://your_server/api/v1/account/configuration_items/123/items_links/impacted?linked_ci=456
Returns an item link if the ci 456 is impacted by the ci 123

If no parameter is provided, all the impacted ci are returned:
Example: http://your_server/api/v1/account/configuration_items/123/item_links/impacted

Returns all the relations between configuration items that are impacting for the given configuration item

Optionnal linked_ci parameter allows to find if a specific item is impacting the configuration item.

Example: http://your_server/api/v1/account/configuration_items/123/items_links/impacting?linked_ci=456
Returns an item link if the ci 456 is impacting the ci 123

If no parameter is provided, all the impacting ci are returned:
Example: http://your_server/api/v1/account/configuration_items/123/item_links/impacting
Returns a specific link corresponding to a {parent_ci_id} and a {child_ci_id}

put.description:
Updates the configuration item link.
Only relation_type and blocking property can be updated.

post.description: Creates a new configuration item relationship.

delete.description: removes a gien configuration item relationship.

patch.description:
Updates the configuration item link.
Only relation_type and blocking property can be updated.

get.description: Retrieves a list of available domains.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a specific domain.

Returns List of Employees. This resource helps you to get employees list.
If no options are provided, an excerpt of the records is displayed. Example: http://my_server/api/v1/80000/employees?max_rows=3&fields=last_name,begin_of_contract,department_id,e_mail,location_id&search=last_name:"Taverner, David" _Notes:_
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._

parameters.name: max_rows
parameters.description:
Maximum number of rows to be returned.

Example: __/employees?max_rows=5__

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort string.

Syntax: field1[+asc|+desc],field2[+asc|+desc]

Example: __/employees?sort=begin_of_contract+desc__

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Selected fields to be returned

Example: __/employees?fields=last_name, begin_of_contract,department_id, email,location_id__

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search/Filter on fields. Example: __/employees?search=e_mail:"FSDM@itassetservice.com"__ Date filtering is also possible:
__/employees?search=begin_of_contract:last_week__ More information : #docTextSection:tcvZ3t7EuhgHRuaRd

This resource allows to create a new Employee.
Upon success, an HTTP 201 is returned. An HREF to the new resource is provided, and the HTTP Header contains a location information to redirect the client to the newly created resource.
_Note: this method only supports one request creation per call (V1.0)_

get.description:
Returns resources associated to an InternalQuery.

You must provide a query_guid and optionnaly a filter and a view/report guid

_Example : http://my_server/api/v1/80000/internalqueries?max_rows=3&queryguid=6938436D-B024-4B9E-9815-A41C1D7C7A0E&filterguid=D647335C-625E-43E9-94BD-9D397C4285EF_

Returns List of known problems.

This resource helps you to get known problems list.
If no options are provided, an excerpt of the records is displayed.

Example: http://your_server/api/v1/account/known-problems?max_rows=3&fields=answer_en,creation_date,last_update_ut,version&sort=last_update_ut desc

Notes:
- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned.

Returns List of problem-links. This resource helps you to get problem-links list.
If no options are provided, an excerpt of the records is displayed. _Note: The RFC_NUMBER and the HREF of the resource are always returned._ Example: http://my_server/api/v1/80000/problem-links _Notes:_
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._

parameters.name: max_rows
parameters.description:
Maximum number of rows to be returned.

Example: __/requests?max_rows=5__

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort string.

Syntax: field1[+asc|+desc],field2[+asc|+desc]

Example: __/requests?fields=submit_date_ut+desc__

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Selected fields to be returned

Example: __/requests?fields=submit_date_ut, end_date_ut,requestor.last_name,recipient.e_mail__

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search/Filter on fields. Example: __requests?search=rfc_number:"I161026_000005"__ Date filtering is also possible:
Example: __/requests?search=submit_date_ut:last_week__ More information : #docTextSection:tcvZ3t7EuhgHRuaRd

get.description:

_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._

post.description:
Create an incident Upon success, an HTTP 201 is returned. An HREF to the new resource is provided, and the HTTP Header contains a location information to redirect the client to the newly created resource.
_Note: this method only supports one request creation per call (V1.0)_

get.description:
Returns the specified incident or request This resource helps you to get information about a request or an incident in EVSM. _Notes:_
_- If no parameters (fields) are given, all the fields, even E\__ _ones are returned._
_- Some sensitive fields reserved to Easyvista are not returned._ Example: **requests/I161026_000005**

put.description:
Update an incident or request.

Upon success an HTTP 201 OK is returned. The URI to the updated resources is provided, and the HTTP Header constains a location information to redirect the client to the newly created resource.

If the record is not found, a 404 error is returned.

If a mix of existing fields and non-existing fields is provided, the resource returns 201 OK, as long as at least one field can be found and can be modified. If nothing is modified, the query is considered as bad : 400 - bad request

patch.description:
Update an incident or request.

Upon success an HTTP 201 OK is returned. The URI to the updated resources is provided, and the HTTP Header constains a location information to redirect the client to the newly created resource.

If the record is not found, a 404 error is returned.

If a mix of existing fields and non-existing fields is provided, the resource returns 201 OK, as long as at least one field can be found and can be modified. If nothing is modified, the query is considered as bad : 400 - bad request

post.summary: Create an action related to an incident
post.description: Create an action related to an incident (EZV_CreateRelatedAction)

get.summary: Get Questionnaires from non terminated actions

get.description:
Note: This function replace the previous one that reversed the url path (request/comment/{RFC_NUMBER : this syntax is now deprecated)

Returns the comment associated to the specified incident or request

This resource also returns, as usual, the HREF of the comment request and the HREF of the associated request.



Example: **requests/I161026_000005/comment**

get.summary: Get the list of Documents of a Request / Incident
get.description: Get attach document to a request

post.summary: Upload and attach a Document  to a Request / Incident
post.description: Uploads a file (docx, pdf, txt or image file) and attach it to the specified request. Upon success, an HTTP 201 is returned. An HREF to the new document resource is provided, and the HTTP Header contains a location information to redirect the client to the request associated to the newly created resource.

get.summary: Get a specific of Document of a Request / Incident
get.description: Get a specific attached document to a request
Problem link to the request

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new task related to the incident or request specified in the URL.

To define the type of action to be created, you can pass either the __action_type_id__ OR the __action_type_name__ (in the language of the RESTAPI user).

To define the group assigned to the task, you can pass either the __group_id__, __group_name__ or __group_mail__.

put.description:
To close an incident or request, update it with the optional "close" object.

This close object must contains a valid status GUID, and optional fields like "end date". Doing so, the workflow will be stopped, the incident/request will be closed and further updates will be impossible.

Upon success an HTTP 201 OK is returned. The URI to the updated resources is provided, and the HTTP Header constains a location information to redirect the client to the newly created resource.

If the record is not found, a 404 error is returned.

patch.description:
To close an incident or request, update it with the optional "closed" object.

This close object must contains a valid status GUID, and optional fields like "end date". Doing so, the workflow will be stopped, the incident/request will be closed and further updates will be impossible.

Upon success an HTTP 201 OK is returned. The URI to the updated resources is provided, and the HTTP Header constains a location information to redirect the client to the newly created resource.

If the record is not found, a 404 error is returned.

put.description:
To suspend an incident or request, update it with the optional "suspended" object along with a comment.

Upon success an HTTP 201 OK is returned. The URI to the updated resources is provided, and the HTTP Header contains a location information to redirect the client to the newly updated resource.

If the record is not found, a 404 error is returned.

If the record is not in the correct state to complete the operation, a 405 error is returned

patch.description:
To suspend an incident or request, update it with the optional "suspended" object along with a comment.

Upon success an HTTP 201 OK is returned. The URI to the updated resources is provided, and the HTTP Header contains a location information to redirect the client to the newly updated resource.

If the record is not found, a 404 error is returned.

If the record is not in the correct state to complete the operation, a 405 error is returned

put.description:
To resume an incident or request, update it with the optional "restarted" object along with a comment.

Upon success an HTTP 201 OK is returned. The URI to the updated resources is provided, and the HTTP Header contains a location information to redirect the client to the newly updated resource.

If the record is not found, a 404 error is returned.

If the record is not in the correct state to complete the operation, a 405 error is returned

patch.description:
To resume an incident or request, update it with the optional "restarted" object along with a comment.

Upon success an HTTP 201 OK is returned. The URI to the updated resources is provided, and the HTTP Header contains a location information to redirect the client to the newly updated resource.

If the record is not found, a 404 error is returned.

If the record is not in the correct state to complete the operation, a 405 error is returned

get.description:
Note: !! This syntax is __deprecated__. We recommend you to use the following instead :
__/request/{RFC_NUMBER}/comment__

Returns the comment associated to the specified incident or request

This resource also returns, as usual, the HREF of the comment request and the HREF of the associated request.


Example: **requests/comment/I161026_000005**

__/assets?search=employee.begin_of_contract:last_week__ More information : #docTextSection:tcvZ3t7EuhgHRuaRd

post.description: Insert a new record in "E_Your_table". This resource helps you to use extern tables.

put.description: Update the record of "E_Your_table" using primary key {id} This resource helps you to update extern tables.

delete.description: Delete the record of "E_Your_table" using primary key {id} This resource helps you to delete extern tables.

patch.description: Update the record of "E_Your_table" using primary key {id} This resource helps you to update extern tables.

post.description: Generate a token for the connected user. If the params `token_endpoint_allowed` is set to true in the rest-api.ini file the endpoint will be allowed. By default it's not allowed for security.

delete.description: Delete a token by passing it in as an identifier

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Must be a Bearer Token

get.summary: Get the first questionnaire from a workflow linked to a request

parameters.name: rfc_number|request_id
parameters.description: Can be a RFC number or a request_id
